I sat next to Tony leaning on the headboard, without nudging or asking he laid his head on my chest and wrapped his arms around me. I pulled the covers up and around us and ran my fingers through his hair. I was doing my best to control my own breathing, tried to focus on deep breaths like he’d done for me earlier. I traced patterns onto his back and started to sing the words to the song. My shirt damp with tears that silently fled his eyes, I leaned down and kissed the top of his head.

“It’s alright, you don’t have to say anything. It’s about time for someone to share that weight. Nothing leaves this place, in this bed, in these arms, you’re not Iron Man or the Billionaire playboy, you’re just Tony, nothing more nothing less. You move or talk whenever you’re ready, I’m not going anywhere.” I could feel his head nod as I stroked his hair. “Would it bother you if I talked?” He shook his head no, now I knew what he meant when he told me it broke him to see me in a full blown panic attack, I felt it towards him right now.

“You said something earlier that bothered me, couldn’t get it out of my head, a typical woman right?” I could feel his forehead scrunch up. “You said you had a soft spot for me, now that could mean various things by my thinking. Maybe it means you view me as just a friend, or maybe an annoying little sister or maybe its a long shot though that you uh…feel something a little deeper.” His breathing had slowed, tears stopped flowing, I could see his eyes go wide in emotion I couldn’t place. “My money, what little I’ve got, is on the latter and that would explain why my favorite snacks and alcohol are the only ones ever fully stocked, or why my shower seems to have an endless supply of hot water, or why my battle uniform is suddenly made out of some new fangled kevlar that quite literally saved my ass earlier today. This isn’t the time to really have this conversation like you stated earlier, but we will at sometime soon revisit this.” I hugged him tightly, kissing the top of his head again. He smelled like sage, musk, cedar, and hint of lavender, I internally laughed almost thinking he’d smell of WD-40, Vibrainium and blow torch fumes.

“It sucks to feel like this, I thought it was better to keep it all inside because I’d rather the pain destroy me than everyone else around me, but it took until you today to get me to realize that I wasn’t protecting anyone from my pain, I hurt someone very dear to me. My Grandmother used to say, 'if you can’t get someone off your mind; it’s because your mind always knows what your heart is thinking.’ I don’t think there’s a day that’s gone by that he hasn’t been on my mind, but that’s for another day I suppose.”

We laid in silence for hours after that, falling asleep clutching on tightly to each other. It was the first restful nights’ sleep in a while. The light from sunrise gleamed through the bedroom window straight into my eyes waking me from a pleasant dream.   My eyes groggily opened to see the fireplace still going, the music still playing, I was spooning Tony who laid in front of me. My right arm numb from his weight sleeping on it all night, I tried to move my arm from beneath him without waking him up. I felt his fingers intertwine in my left hand, he brought it to his lips, kissing my knuckles.

“Mornin’ Angel.” He groaned moving slightly so I could take back my numb and momentarily useless arm, he landed on his back, eyes watching intently as I sat up and rubbed the life back into my arm.

“DIdn’t mean to wake you,” I smiled sheepishly.

“I’ve been awake for a while, I didn’t want to move if I’m being fully honest. By the way, do you know you snore? I mean it’s so soft that it’s kind of cute but still you snore,” the way he laughed made his eyes lit up, a big difference than how they looked when I found him last night.

“I do not!” Playfully slapping his arm, “whatever, you talk in your sleep.”

“Mhm, did I say anything incriminating?” An eye quirked upward.

“Just that you love me and you were trying to fight the Galaxy to prove it.”

“Sounds about right. Dinner tonight?” He smirked. “Just me and you. Then we can revisit your conversation last night and plan for the future.”

“The future?” I tilted my head in confusion.

title: Spider-Man: Beginning of the End
description:
by thatispunacceptable

After accidentally killing a man in New York, Peter, weighed down by the guilt of failing to live up to Tony’s perceived expectations and being a self proclaimed murderer, runs away to Washington D.C. where he keeps a low profile, not wanting to disturb anyones lives. However, with a plan to allow intergalactic persons to take up citizenship on earth, Steve Rogers, Natasha Romanov and Tony Stark find them selves working in D.C over the Christmas holiday. When strange muggings are thwarted around the city, they suspect that their lost Spider-ling has once again resurfaced and a new, much greater threat is preparing to take over the universe.

(This will only make a little bit of sense unless you read the other works. Soz fam.)
((But do what you want, I’m not your boss.))

summary: to find a secret (behind the ruins)
title: to find a secret (behind the ruins)
body:
by dapperyklutz

As is the case in Tony’s life, it starts with an accident.

“This… is not the coffee pot,” he says dumbly.

“Astute observation as always, sir,” JARVIS replies dryly, though there’s no mistaking the hint of astonishment in his voice.

Tony blinks once more before he gapes at the hammer in his hand. Specifically, he’s holding Thor’s hammer. He has Mjölnir in his hand.

Like, what even.

—

Or, 5 occasions Tony wields Mjölnir in front of his teammates (and he shies away from it every time), and 1 time he wields it for the whole world to see.
